I work out because I absolutely LOVE the after-burn. I After years of trying to figure out what works best for me, I have figured out that I love home workouts. I usually do them in the mid-afternoon while my kids are napping. If I don't work out while the kids are napping, I tend to sit and be more sedentary than what I like to be (most days....sedentary days have their place in my life, too, but not everyday!). I have a wide variety of dumbbells and a treadmill, so my favorite thing to do is set up a favorite show on my laptop and bring it in my room while I do a cardio and strength training combo. I usually do a 1-mile warm-up on the treadmill and then hop off and do a couple of sets of compound movements with weights (squats to overhead press, bicep curls in a lunge position, etc), hop back on the treadmill for a few minutes, hop off and do another couple of sets of compound movements with weights, etc.  On days where I'm either really busy or just not feeling it, I work out for 30 minutes, but 45-60 minutes is my goal. I try to work out 4, sometimes 5, days per week. Oh, and I will never have a 6 pack. I absolutely love how I feel when eating healthy, clean, and green, but I also really love a good cheeseburger and some ice cream on occasion! It's all about balance and enjoying life!

Nikole, you are beautiful!  I am a gym girl. I eat healthy and exercise but I love food. I'll never have a 6 pack either. I'm ok with being accepting my body the way it is.  There are so many factors that come into play, genetics, diet, age etc.  I used to beat myself up if the number on the scale wasn't what I wanted it to be. (I was very thin) Then, menopause hit and no matter what I did I gained weight. I refuse to starve myself and beat myself up anymore. I am a child of God. This is the body He gave me and I will be thankful for what I can do. I am blessed to be able to exercise. My husband loves me and my daughter has a healthy perspective regarding diet and exercise.  You keep doing exactly what you are doing and take each day as a blessing. :)

1. The rush of good feel energy I get after, the adrenaline rush is insane2. I get the best sleep ever after working out (that doesn't exist anymore after baby :) )3.
